body: Thank you for reporting the issue. Can you install `v1.0.2` correctly (only occurs `v1.0.3`)?

How did you install with 'v1.0.2', is it working? I am also facing the similar problem.

> > > Thank you for reporting the issue. Can you install `v1.0.2` correctly (only occurs `v1.0.3`)?
> > 
> > 
> > Yes, I can up the server in `v1.0.2` , but failed in `master (v1.0.3?)`
> 
> How did you install with 'v1.0.2', is it working? I am also facing the similar problem.

I just follow the document
```
$ git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git
$ cd doccano
$ git checkout v1.0.2
$ docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
```
Hope it help~

issue.title: Resolve build fail

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
There's an upstream issue with babel which affects node.js 13.1.0 (see: https://github.com/babel/babel/pull/11006 ) which prevents doccano from building (see #526), even when rolling back to v1.0.2.

This can be resolved by upgrading to node.js 13.2.0

body:
> > > > Thank you for reporting the issue. Can you install `v1.0.2` correctly (only occurs `v1.0.3`)?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Yes, I can up the server in `v1.0.2` , but failed in `master (v1.0.3?)`
> > 
> > 
> > How did you install with 'v1.0.2', is it working? I am also facing the similar problem.
> 
> I just follow the document
> 
> ```
> $ git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git
> $ cd doccano
> $ git checkout v1.0.2
> $ docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
> ```
> 
> Hope it help~

It's still facing the same error. I tried on v1.0.1 also but still not working.

- **Python version**:

I've tried tweaking my docker configs but no luck.

- Increased docker memory to 8192
- Increased swap to 2048

body: You can fix this by changing the nodejs version from 13.1.0 to 13.6 in frontend/Dockerfile.

> You can fix this by changing the nodejs version from 13.1.0 to 13.6 in frontend/Dockerfile.

I fix this by changing nodejs to 13.2.0 in frontend/Dockerfile. So I think any nodejs version above 13.1.0 works well.

This problem is fixed by https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/539.
Thank you for @meseta.

issue.title: ERROR: Service 'frontend' failed to build: The command '/bin/sh -c npm install' returned a non-zero code: 1

Your Environment
---------

*   Docker version 19.03.8
*   When you install doccano:  https://github.com/doccano/doccano/releases/tag/v1.0.2

```
git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=input
cd doccano
git checkout v1.0.2
docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
```
Note: I changed the node version to 13.2.0 as describer in #526
